intro: Quercus petraea subsp. polycarpa, commonly known as the sessile oak, is a deciduous tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mixed forests. This subspecies is notable for its robust growth and adaptability to different environmental conditions.
